Text saved: Most kinds of spiders have **venom**, which is a poisonous liquid they produce to stun or kill the animals they hunt for food, not to attack people. In fact, only 25 known kinds of spiders produce venom that can really harm humans, and although their bites can be painful, they are not often deadly. For example, Australia has the Sydney funnel-web spider, which is famous for being dangerous, but this spider has not killed anyone since doctors made an anti-venom in 1981.

However, you should be careful not to annoy hairy spiders, like tarantulas. This is because when they feel they are in danger, they protect themselves by sending out a cloud of **urticating hairs**, which are special hairs that can cause itching and irritation. These irritating hairs then stick into the skin or eyes of the attacker.
